citation.article-title: Rubritepida flocculans gen. nov., sp. nov., a new slightly thermophilic member of the α-1 subclass of the Proteobacteria.

p.s: Rubritepida (Ru. bri. te´ pi. da, L. adj. rubrus, red; L. adj. tepidus, warm; N. L. fem. adj. rubritepida, the red-warm one)
Rubritepida forms short rod-shaped cells that stain Gram-negative.
Strictly aerobic, cytochrome oxidase and catalase positive.
Bacteriochlorophyll a is present during growth in the dark and in the presence of oxygen.

Fatty acids are straight-chained; 19:0 2OH cyclo 11,12 is present; major phospholipids are phosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylethanolamine, diphosphatidylglycerol and phosphatidylglycerol; ubiquinone 9 is the major respiratory quinone.
Reduced sulfur compounds are oxidized to sulfate.
Sugars, organic acids and amino acids serve as single carbon sources.
Phylogenetically a member of the α-1 subclass of Proteobacteria.
